title: [2.16.4] CDI fails when the OpenAPI extension is added to the project
body:
### Describe the bug

Configuration data is no longer being injected when the OpenAPI plugin is added to the project. This was working properly in the 2.15.x line.

### Expected behavior

CDI should work as advertised and extensions should play nice with each other ðŸ™‚ 
The reproducer tests should work well

### Actual behavior

Configuration data is not being injected into beans when the OpenAPI extension is added

### How to Reproduce?

Reproducer: Clone this repository: https://github.com/roguexz/quarkus-sample/tree/3b7ea0293f5206a231ba0d4c19161637441b41d3

**Steps:**
* Run `./gradlew clean test`. You will observe that the tests are failing
* In `build.gradle` comment the OpenAPI extension and run the command again, you will observe that the test passes properly

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Darwin xxxxxx 22.3.0 Darwin Kernel Version 22.3.0: Mon Jan 30 20:42:11 PST 2023; root:xnu-8792.81.3~2/RELEASE_X86_64 x86_64

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "11.0.17" 2022-10-18 LTS
OpenJDK Runtime Environment Zulu11.60+20-SA (build 11.0.17+8-LTS)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM Zulu11.60+20-SA (build 11.0.17+8-LTS, mixed mode)

_No response_
